column2: Do you realize this is probably the last time we\xc2\x92ll all be here in\nthe coffee house as six single people?'
Why?! What\xc2\x92s happening to the coffee house?! (Monica looks at her.)\nOh! (Realizes.)'
Yep! From now on its gonna be the four of you guys and me and the\nmisses. The little woman. The wife. The old ball and chain.'
Old?'
The young hot ball and chain.'
That\xc2\x92s much better.'
(checking her watch) Op! We gotta go! (The girls stand up.)'
Oh, where are you guys going?'
We\xc2\x92re gonna pick up the wedding dress then we\xc2\x92re gonna have\nlunch with mom. (Joey stands up.)'
Ah. Joey you\xc2\x92re-you\xc2\x92re having lunch with my mom?'
No, I-I just heard lunch. But yeah, I can go. Sure! (They all exit.)'
(To Chandler) Y\xc2\x92know what? Actually I\xc2\x92m kinda glad they\xc2\x92re\nleaving \xc2\x91cause uh, I need to talk to you about something.'
What\xc2\x92s up?'
Well this uh, this may be a little awkward.'
Listen, if you want to borrow money, its kind of a bad time. I\xc2\x92m\nbuying dinner for 128 people tomorrow night.'
No, its\xc2\x85Its not that. Umm, now what I\xc2\x92m going to say to you,\nI\xc2\x92m not saying as your friend. Okay? I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m saying as it as\nMonica\xc2\x92s older brother.'
But you\xc2\x92re still my friend?'
Not for the next few minutes.'
During this time\xc2\x85are you, are you still my best man?'
Nope.'
Do I still call you Ross?'

Okay! You guys are getting married tomorrow and-and I couldn\xc2\x92t be
more thrilled for both of you, but as Monica\xc2\x92s older brother I-I have to tell you
this. If you ever hurt my little sister, if you ever cause her any unhappiness of any
kind, I will hunt you down, and kick your ass! (Chandler laughs.) What?
I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m serious! (Chandler laughs harder.) Come\xc2\x97Hey! Dude! Stop
it! Okay? I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m not kidding here!'
(smiling) Hey, I hear what your saying, okay? And, thanks for the\nwarning.'
No problem.'
So are we\xc2\x85friends again?'
Yeah.'
Okay. (Pause) You won\xc2\x92t believe what Monica\xc2\x92s older\nbrother just said to me!'
What \xc2\x91cha doing Mon?'
I\xc2\x92m making a list of all the things that are most likely to go\nwrong at the wedding. Now, that way I can be prepared.'
What are they?'
Well, so far I have uh, my bride\xc2\x92s maids dresses won\xc2\x92t get\npicked up, my veil gets lost, or I don\xc2\x92t have my something blue.'
Hey! Those are all the things I\xc2\x92m responsible for!'
I had to go with the odds Rach.'
(entering) Hey! You guys! Remember that audition I had a while ago and\ndidn\xc2\x92t get the part?'
The commercial?'
No!'
That play?'
No!'
That other play?'
Nooo!'
The movie?'
Yes!!'
Ohh!'
Yes that\xc2\x92s the one about the soldiers who fight in World War I!'
Oh, yeah! Back then y\xc2\x92know, we called the Great War. It really was!'
Well anyway, the guy they wanted backed out and now they want me! I start\nshooting today!'
Congratulations!'
Oh that\xc2\x92s great!'
Wait! Wait! Wait! You can\xc2\x92t start today! Today\xc2\x92s the rehearsal\ndinner!'
Oh no, I\xc2\x92ll be done by then.'
Oh. Well then way to go you big movie star!'
I know! All right, I\xc2\x92ll see you guys over there! I\xc2\x92m off to\nfight the Nazis.'
Oh, wait Joey! We fought the Nazis in World War II, not World War I.'
Whoa! Okay. Yeah well, who-who was in World War I? (Rachel pauses as she\nthinks.)'
Go ahead.'
You\xc2\x92re gonna be late! Go! Go! (He runs out.)'
Who did we fight in World War I?'
Mexico?'
Yes! Very good.'
(approaching) Hey Joey! We\xc2\x92re ready.'
Yeah! Me too. (He pats his pocket.)'
(to another actor) Richard? We\xc2\x92re ready for you.\n(Richard approaches.) Joey Tribbiani? This is Richard Crosby he\xc2\x92s playing Vincent.'
I\xc2\x92m doing my scenes with you?'
Nice to meet you Joey.'
Wow! I can\xc2\x92t believe this! This is incredible. I mean you just won an\nOscar!'
No I didn\xc2\x92t.'
I think you did.'
I think I lost. Three times.'
Uh\xc2\x85Cookie?'
(approaching) Okay! We\xc2\x92re about an hour away from getting the\nscene lit. So uh, if you guys don\xc2\x92t mind, can we run it a couple of times?'
Yeah, sure.'
Okay, all right. Let\xc2\x92s do it. (He walks off.)\nAnd\xc2\x85Action!'
We have to find the rest of the platoon!'
Forget the platoon! The platoon is gone! (He is spitting on the hard Ps\nand Ts.)'
(wiping his face) What?!'
(still spitting) The platoon is dead! Face facts Tony!'
(wipes face) So what are we gonna do?! We have no reinforcements! No-no\nfood!'
No, we still have food in the basement! I saw potatoes and some dry\npasta!'
Hang on a minute! Joey, you keep touching your face. Is something\nwrong?'

(glances at Richard) No. Nope, I uh\xc2\x85I th\xc2\x97I thought it might be\nkind of a cool character thing. Y\xc2\x92know? He\xc2\x92s uh, he\xc2\x92s a face toucher.\n(Behind his back, Richard is nodding no.)'
I don\xc2\x92t think so. Let\xc2\x92s take it back to Richard\xc2\x92s\nlast line. (Walks off.) Action!'
We may not have any weapons, but we still have food. In the basement I\nsaw potatoes and some dry pasta, and a few tins of tuna! (Joey backs away and wipes his\nface again.)'
Honey, we gotta go!'
(entering from the bedroom) Okay. Here\xc2\x92s a question you never\nhave to ask. My dad just called and wanted to know if he could borrow one of your pearl\nnecklaces.'
(laughs) I don\xc2\x92t have anything like that, but let me go see if\nRachel does.'
Yes, include more people in this.'
Hey, do you realize that at this time tomorrow we\xc2\x92ll be getting\nmarried?'
Wait a minute! I have a date tomorrow night.'
I just, I can\xc2\x92t believe that we made it!'
Well you don\xc2\x92t have to sound so surprised.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry but\xc2\x85nothing.'
What?'
Well\xc2\x85honestly ever since we got engaged I have been waiting for\nsomething to, to flip you out.'
Honestly? Me too.'
Really?'
Yeah. Y\xc2\x92know I keep thinking that something stupid is gonna come\nup and I\xc2\x92ll go all\xc2\x85Chandler. But nothing has.'
Ohh, I\xc2\x92m so glad. Thank you so much for staying so calm during\nthis. I mean it\xc2\x92s really, it\xc2\x92s made me stay calm. (Chandler just looks at her.)\nI coulda been worse!'
Okay. I\xc2\x92ll be right there.'

(voice on answering machine) Hi! If you\xc2\x92re calling before Saturday,\nyou\xc2\x92ve reached Monica and Chandler. But if you\xc2\x92re calling after Saturday,\nyou\xc2\x92ve reached Mr. and Mrs. Bing! Please leave a message for the Bings!'
Hey Maureen! (They hug.) Gosh! Hey uh, Chandler? This is my cousin\nMaureen.'
We\xc2\x92re the Bings.'
Hi! Oh you guys look so beautiful!'
Mr. and Mrs. Bing! (Walks away.)'
(walks up) Wow Monica! Hey, just so you know I had my uh, older brother\nchat with Chandler.'
What is that?'

Well I\xc2\x85I told him that if he ever hurt you I would hunt him down and\nkick his ass! (The girls all laugh.) What?! What?! What is the matter with everybody?! I\nam serious! I would kick his ass! (The laugh harder.)'
Ross, please! My make-up! (He walks away angrily.)'
Hi.'
Chandler!'
Mom. Thanks for wearing something. (They hug.) (She\xc2\x92s wearing a\ntight dress with a lot of cleavage showing.)'

Oh honey! This is so exciting! I thought we screwed you up so bad\nthis day would never come. Oh and just think. Soon there\xc2\x92ll be lots of little Bings.\n(He freaks out and loosens the tie again.) '
Mrs. Bing? Here, these are my parents umm, Judy and Jack Geller.'
(shaking her hand) It\xc2\x92s lovely to meet you.'
(shaking her hand) So are you his mother or his father?'
Jack!'
What?! I\xc2\x92ve never seen one before!'
Dad! There\xc2\x92s Ross (points), why don\xc2\x92t you go talk to him?'
I didn\xc2\x92t even have a chance to act as though I\xc2\x92m okay with\nit!'
(entering) Hello all!'
Hi\xc2\x85dad.'
Hi Mr.\xc2\x85Bing.'
Nora!'
Charles.'
It-it\xc2\x92s so great to see you both here.'
Yes! Although, I think we may be seeing a little too much of some\npeople. Aren\xc2\x92t you a little old to be wearing a dress like that?'
Don\xc2\x92t you have a little too much penis to be wearing a dress\nlike that?'
Oh my God! (He and Monica walk away.)'
\xc2\x85of course you can kick his ass son.'
You could kick anyone\xc2\x92s ass you want too.'
Thanks you guys. (Walks away happily and his parents smile.)'
Oh, Rach! Rach! Umm hey, could you do me a favor and would talk to\nChandler\xc2\x92s dad and try to keep him away from Chandler\xc2\x92s mom?'
Yeah! But I don\xc2\x92t know what he looks like!'
He is the man in the black dress.'
Man in the black dress\xc2\x85 (Monica walks away and Rachel looks around\nto find a woman in a black dress.) (To her) Hi! I\xc2\x92m Rachel! I\xc2\x92m a friend of\nMonica and Chandler\xc2\x92s!'
I\xc2\x92m Amanda.'
Oh I get it! A\xc2\x85man\xc2\x85duh!'
(clinking a wine glass) Can I have everyone\xc2\x92s attention please?\nI\xc2\x92m uh; I\xc2\x92m Ross Geller.'
Doctor Ross Geller.'

Dad\xc2\x85dad, please! As I was saying umm, I\xc2\x92m Dr. Ross Geller. Uhh,
and I\xc2\x92m the best man. And uh, this marriage is doubly special for me umm, because not
only is the groom my best friend but uh, the bride is my little sister. And, she\xc2\x92s
the greatest sister a guy could ask for. So if you\xc2\x92d all please join me in raising a
glass to the, the couple we\xc2\x92re here to celebrate. (Everyone does so.) To the Bings.'
To the Bings!'
All right, I\xc2\x92m gonna go steam my wedding dress okay? Who wants the\nresponsibility of making sure nothing happens to it?'
I\xc2\x92ll do it.'
Who wants it? Anybody?'
I said I\xc2\x92ll do it!'
Nobody wants to do it? All right, I\xc2\x92ll do it myself.'
Monica! I\xc2\x92m not gonna screw it up!'
Y\xc2\x92know what? You\xc2\x92re right, I\xc2\x92m sorry. Actually you were a\nbig help tonight. Yeah, and thanks for putting my grandmother in the cab and making sure\nshe got to the hotel safely.'
Well of course that is what I\xc2\x92m here for!'
Okay. Sorry. (Monica goes into the bathroom.)'
Ugh! (To Phoebe) What grandmother?'
Hey! Where have you been?'
Oh, taking my parents back to the hotel.'
Oh.'
What? Are you going back to work?'
Yeah.'
Nice shades.'
Thanks. Yeah, I figure if I wear these in my scenes at least I won\xc2\x92t\nget spit in the eyes, y\xc2\x92know?'
And if I remember correctly, Ray Ban was the official sponsor of\nWorld War I!'
Great! All right. I\xc2\x92ll see you later. (He starts to leave.)'
Hey, where\xc2\x92s Chandler?'
Uh, I think he\xc2\x92s in Rachel\xc2\x92s room. See ya. (Exits.)'

(going up to Rachel\xc2\x92s closed door) Chandler? (He opens the door and\nlooks inside and doesn\xc2\x92t see him.) Chandler? (He checks the bathroom and still\ndoesn\xc2\x92t find him. He then finds a note on the counter. He picks it up and reads it.)'
Hey! '
Hi!'
Is uh, is Monica here?'
She\xc2\x92s steaming her dress, why? What\xc2\x92s up?'
I think Chandler\xc2\x92s gone. (He hands her the note.)'
What?!'
He left that.'
(reading the note) Tell Monica I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
(walking up) What\xc2\x92s up? (Rachel hands her the note and she reads\nit.) Tell Monica I\xc2\x92m sorry. (Pause) Tell her yourself!'
Oh my God! Chandler just left though!'
Yeah but, maybe it\xc2\x92s not what we think. Maybe it\xc2\x92s tell Monica\nI\xc2\x92m sorry I\xc2\x85drank the last of the milk.'
Or maybe he-he was writing to tell her that-that he\xc2\x92s changed his\nname, y\xc2\x92know? Tell Monica I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
I think it means he freaked out and left!'
Don\xc2\x92t be so negative! Good God! Isn\xc2\x92t it possible that Sorry\nis sitting in there (Joey and Rachel\xc2\x92s apartment) right now?!'
Okay. Phoebe, I-I think Ross is right. What are we gonna do?'
Look\xc2\x97Okay, I\xc2\x92m just gonna\xc2\x97I\xc2\x92m gonna have to go find\nhim and bring him back! Okay? You-you make sure Monica does not find out, okay?'
Okay.'
(pointing at Ross) Okay but if you don\xc2\x92t find him and bring\nhim back, I am gonna hunt you down and kick your ass!'
(scared) I will, I will find him.'
Hey Joey, could you uh, go through these lines with me? (He\xc2\x92s\nholding a script.)'
Oh man! They-they just redid my make-up!'
Just the last two pages.'
All right.'
I found the picture! '
Picture? What picture?'
Could you uh, could you lower your script? I need to see your face so I\ncan uh, play off your reaction.'
Okay uh, look I know you\xc2\x92re a great actor, okay? And you play all\nthose Shakespeare guys and stuff\xc2\x85'
Oh, thanks.'
But you\xc2\x92re spittin\xc2\x92 all over me man!'
Well of course I am!'
You know you\xc2\x92ve been spitting on me?!'
That\xc2\x92s what real actors do! Annunciation is the mark of a good\nactor! And when you enunciate, you spit! (Spits on the t) '
(wiping face) Wow! Didn\xc2\x92t know that.'
Great!'
Thanks! Okay-okay check it out! (Reading from the script) Picture? What\npicture? (He pauses then spits) Eh?'
Gunther have you uh, have you seen Chandler?'
No. No, I haven\xc2\x92t seen him.'
Oh damn!'
He\xc2\x92s getting married tomorrow right?'
Yes. Yes. Don\xc2\x92t worry. Everything\xc2\x92s fine. We\xc2\x92ll uh,\nwe\xc2\x92ll see you tomorrow at the wedding.'
I wasn\xc2\x92t invited.'

Well then we\xc2\x92ll-we\xc2\x92ll see you the day after tomorrow. (Walks\naway slowly, but notices something.) Mom?! Dad?! (They\xc2\x92re sitting by the window.)\nWhat-what\xc2\x85what you guys doing here?!'
Well you kids talk about this place so much, we thought we\xc2\x92d\nsee what all the fuss is about.'
I certainly see what the girls like coming here.'
Why?!'
The sexy blonde behind the counter. (She waves at Gunther who waves\nback.)'
(shocked) Gunther?!'
Your mother just added him to her list.'
What? Your-your list?'
Yeah, the list that\xc2\x97of people we\xc2\x92re allowed to\nsleep\xc2\x85'
Yes! No-no! I know, I know what the list is! Mom! Look if you see\nChandler, could you just let him know I\xc2\x92m looking for him?'
And if you see Rita Moreno, let her know I\xc2\x92m looking for her.'
Action!'
I found the picture!'
What picture?!'
The picture of my wife! In your pack!'
You went through my personal property?'
Why do have a picture of Paulette in your pack?!'
(pause) Because Vincent, we were lovers. (Pause) For two years!'
Cut! Wonderful!'
Great scene yeah?'
Oh you\xc2\x92re awesome! And, in that last speech? You soaked me.'
Thanks a lot.'
(To Joey) Here\xc2\x92s your call sheet for tomorrow.'
Oh, I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m not working tomorrow.'
You are now.'
No! No! I can\xc2\x92t! You gotta get me out of it! I\xc2\x92ve got plans!\n(Spits.) Important plans! (Spits on the Ps.)'
(closing the door) Ross said there\xc2\x92s still no word from Chandler.'
Oh man.'
Oh but he did say that they found the grandmother wandering down fifth\navenue.'
Okay. Well there\xc2\x92s one down.'

(entering from her room, excitedly) I\xc2\x92m getting married today!!!\n(She trips and falls.) (Getting up) I think I just cracked a rib. But I don\xc2\x92t care\nbecause today\xc2\x92s my wedding day! My day is finally here!! (Runs back into her room.)'
Y\xc2\x92know she might not even notice he\xc2\x92s gone.'
(re-entering) I\xc2\x92m gonna start getting ready! (Goes back into her\nroom.)'

God! Don\xc2\x92t\xc2\x97We can\xc2\x92t let her start getting ready! This is\ntoo awful! Oh God, but wait she\xc2\x92ll be in the gown and then he won\xc2\x92t show up and\nthen she\xc2\x92s gonna have to take off the gown\xc2\x85'
Shhh! Stop it! Stop it Rachel! You can\xc2\x92t do this here! (She drags\nher into the bathroom.)'
I\xc2\x92m sorry. I\xc2\x92m sorry. It\xc2\x92s just\xc2\x85It\xc2\x92s just so\nsad!'
Yeah, but you\xc2\x92ve got to pull yourself together! Monica can\xc2\x92t\nsee you like this! Then she\xc2\x92ll know something\xc2\x92s wrong!'
I know. I know. Oh God. (Looking around) There\xc2\x92s no tissue! Can you\ngrab me some toilet paper?'
Yeah. (Looks.) Oh, that\xc2\x92s gone too. This is Monica\xc2\x92s\nbathroom right?!'
Oh!'
No-no! I-I\xc2\x85I found one.'
Okay.'
Oh thank you! (Wiping her nose.) Oh God! (She throws it out.) Can I have\nanother one?'
(looking into the trash can) Sure. (Reaching into the trash can.) Do you\nneed some floss? (Grabs a piece of it.)'
Oh God I just can not imagine what is gonna happen if Chandler\ndoesn\xc2\x92t show up!'
Oh here\xc2\x92s a whole bunch.'
Oh, I mean she\xc2\x92s gonna be at the wedding waiting for him and people\nwill be whispering, "Oh that poor girl." Y\xc2\x92know? Then she\xc2\x92ll have to\ncome back here and live all alone.'
(finding something interesting in the trash can) Oh my God!'
What?'
There was a pregnancy test in the garbage, and it\xc2\x92s positive.\nMonica\xc2\x92s pregnant. (Rachel covers her mouth.) So I guess she won\xc2\x92t be totally\nalone.'
Oh my God!'
I know! Monica\xc2\x92s gonna have a baby! Hey, can this count as her\nsomething new?'
Oh my God!'
Hey, do you think this is why Chandler took off?'
No, she had to have just taken that test because I took out the trash\nlast night.'
Oh God, this is turning into the worst wedding day ever! The bride is\npregnant. The groom is missing. And I\xc2\x92m still holding this. (She throws the test back\ninto the trash.)'
Okay Phoebe, we can not tell anyone about this.'
Right.'
Okay?'
Yeah, okay. Hey, wait. Do you know what kind of birth control she was\nusing?'
No. Why?'
Just for the future, this is hardly a commercial for it.'
Anything?'
No! I talked to Joey on the set, he hasn\xc2\x92t heard from him. I-I-I\ntalked to Chandler\xc2\x92s parents again!'
You told them he was missing?'
No! I made it seem like I was just calling to chat. Pretty sure, they both\nthink I\xc2\x92m interested in them.'
All right, we\xc2\x92ve got to tell her he\xc2\x92s gone. (Starts to leave.)'
No! Hey! Hey! We can\xc2\x92t!'
Ross, she\xc2\x92s gonna start getting ready soon!'
Well, can\xc2\x92t you at least stall her a little? I\xc2\x92ll-I\xc2\x92ll go\nback to some of the places I went last night.'
All right, well how much time do you need?'
Well how much time before she absolutely has to start getting ready?'
One hour.'
Give me two.'
Then why do you ask?!'
Okay, wish me luck.'
Okay. I\xc2\x92m going with you.'
Why?!'
Ross, you\xc2\x92re tired. You\xc2\x92ve been looking all night. And clearly\nyou suck at this.'
All right, I\xc2\x92ll see you guys later.'
Okay. Wait, do you know how you\xc2\x92re going to stall her?'
I\xc2\x92ll figure something out.'
All right. Good luck.'
Thanks.'
Hey! Okay, so I thought we\xc2\x92d start with my make up and then do my\nhair.'
Okay uh, but before you do that. I-I, I need you to talk to me.'
About what?'
Umm\xc2\x85 I\xc2\x92m never gonna getting married!'
Yeah you will! The right guy is just around the corner! Okay, are we\ndone with that?'
No Monica! I\xc2\x92m serious! Oh, maybe I should just forget about it.\nBecome a lesbian or something.'
Any woman would be lucky to have ya.'
Well maybe it would make me feel better if I slept with Joey.'
(jumping up) Rachel! You okay?'

Excuse me, Aaron? (The director turns around.) Hi! Umm, I have a little
problem with the schedules. Originally, I wasn\xc2\x92t supposed to work today, and I have
this wedding that I really have to be at. It\xc2\x92s my best friend\xc2\x92s, and I\xc2\x92m
officiating so I really can\xc2\x92t work past four.'
Joey, you gotta stay until the end. We can\xc2\x92t stop filming\njust for you. It\xc2\x92s not like it\xc2\x92s your wedding. (Starts to walk away.)'
I\xc2\x92m having surgery!'
What?!'
Yeah, I-I just made up the stuff about the wedding because I didn\xc2\x92t\nwant you to worry about me. But, I\xc2\x92m having surgery today.'
What kind of surgery?!'
Transplant.'
But you\xc2\x92re supposed to work on Monday.'
Hair transplant.'
But you\xc2\x92re not bald.'
It\xc2\x92s not on my head.'

Look Joey, there\xc2\x92s nothing I can do. Besides, you\xc2\x92re
probably gonna be out by four anyway. We\xc2\x92ve just got one short scene. It\xc2\x92s just
you and Richard, and God knows he\xc2\x92s a pro. You\xc2\x92ll be fine. (Walks away and sees
Richard entering.) Morning Richard.'
Hey! You\xc2\x92re here! Great! Great! Great! Let\xc2\x92s get going buddy,\nwe\xc2\x92ve got a scene to shoot!'
I\xc2\x92m wearing two belts.'
Are you drunk?'
No!'
Yes you are!'
All right.'
We are never gonna find him! He\xc2\x92s one guy in a huge city!'
Oh my God! Is that him? (She points at someone.)'
That is an old, Chinese woman!'
He could be in disguise, y\xc2\x92know.'

Aw, y\xc2\x92know\xc2\x85Y\xc2\x92know, maybe we\xc2\x92re-we\xc2\x92re just\napproaching this all wrong. If you\xc2\x92re Chandler and-and you wanna hide, where is the\nlast place on Earth people would think you\xc2\x92d go?'
So this is your office?'
How did you guys find me? I knew I should\xc2\x92ve hid at the gym!'
What the hell are you doing?!'
Panicking! And using the Internet to try to prove that I\xc2\x92m\nrelated to Monica. How is she?'
She\xc2\x92s fine. She doesn\xc2\x92t know you\xc2\x92re gone. And she\ndoesn\xc2\x92t have to know, okay? Now come on, we\xc2\x92re going home.'
No! No! No! I can\xc2\x92t do that!'
Why not?!'
Because if I go home, we\xc2\x92re gonna become the Bings! I can\xc2\x92t\nbe the Bings!'
What\xc2\x92s wrong with being the Bings?'
The Bings have horrible marriages! They yell. They fight. And they use\nthe pool boy as a pawn in their sexual games!'
Chandler, have you ever put on a black cocktail dress and asked me up to\nyour hotel room?'
No.'
Then you are neither of your parents!'

It\xc2\x92s not just their marriage! I mean, look at yours. Look at
everybody\xc2\x92s! The only person that can make marriage work is Paul Newman! And
I\xc2\x92ve met me; I am not Paul Newman. I don\xc2\x92t race cars! I don\xc2\x92t make popcorn!
None of my proceeds go to charity.'
But look Chandler, right now, no one has a lower opinion of you than I\ndo. But I totally believe you can do this.'
I want to. I love her so much, but I\xc2\x92m afr\xc2\x85It\xc2\x92s too\nhuge.'

Y\xc2\x92know, okay. You\xc2\x92re right. It is huge. So why don\xc2\x92t we\ntake it just a little bit at a time? Okay? Umm, forget getting married for a sec; just\nforget about it. Can you just come home and take a shower?'
Well yeah, but then\xc2\x85'
(interrupting him) Yeah\xc2\x97No-but-but-but-but! We\xc2\x92re just gonna go\nhome and take a shower. Now, that\xc2\x92s not scary right?'
Depends on what you mean by we.'
